page.title: 03BENGES WOOD
page.content: A large and well known wood made up of mainly beech, sycamore and conifers and some ash. Many beech in this area are suffering from beech bark disease. Lilywhites of Charlton use part of this woodland to run their sawmill. "Benges" is a much used name in the area. The A285 running past the wood is known as "The Benges" and so is the cottage at the top of the rise dividing Ides Common and Benges Wood. Part of the wood is Forestry Commision land and the Forestry Commision has called it Selhurst Park Wood. The locals still call it Benges Wood. Deer are frequently seen here, and warning signs are on the road.
